arguments.response_text:
Hello everybody, my name is Yen, and I am a Filipino who has moved from the Philippines back in 2013 when I was 7.
I didn't know much about my own culture back then.
Well, I did know, I just didn't have much experience, you know, putting myself and doing those traditions.
And even though I wanted to learn more about it here in the U.S., there was not a lot of opportunities for me to do so.
Because in elementary school or in middle school, they didn't have any clubs that would help you learn about your own culture.
You know, there's no, like, Asian club or Filipino club or anything like that.
But now, after coming into high school and in this city where it is very diverse, I was able to find people just like me who also want to learn about the Filipino culture.
Other Filipinos and people who are just genuinely interested in becoming a part of Filipino family.
And for that, I'm grateful that I have moved to Chicago.
Thank you.
arguments.response_summary: The speaker shares their experience of moving from the Philippines to the U.S. and how they have found opportunities to learn about their Filipino culture in Chicago.
arguments.matched_prompt: How did you and your family build a life in Chicago?
